Items.Title:
The President Pro Tempore raps the gavel three times and states:

“I call the Meeting to order.”
Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Riera) rapped the gavel three times and stated: "I call the Meeting to order."

Items.Title:
The President Pro Tempore states:

“Will the Clerk please read the call for today’s Charter Meeting.”
Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) asked: "Will the Clerk please read the call for today's Charter Meeting?"

Items.Title: The Clerk reads:
Items.MinutesNote: The Clerk of the Council and the City Clerk  (Mr. McSweeney) read the Call for the Charter Meeting.

Items.Title:
The President Pro Tempore then states:

“Pursuant to Section 42 of the New York City Charter, I hereby call this meeting to order and direct the City Clerk and the Clerk of the Council to read the communication from the Board of Elections stating the list of elected City Council Members.”

The Clerk reads:
Items.MinutesNote:
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) then stated:

“Pursuant to Section 42 of the New York City Charter, I hereby call this meeting to order and direct the City Clerk and the Clerk of the Council to read the communication from the Board of Elections stating the list of elected City Council Members.”

The Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) read the communication from the Board of Elections stating the list of elected City Council Members.

Items.Title:
The President Pro Tempore will then state:

“Will the City Clerk and the Clerk of the Council perform the formal ceremony of the duly elected Council Members taking their oath of office.”
Items.MinutesNote:
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) then asked:

“Will the City Clerk and the Clerk of the Council perform the formal ceremony of the duly elected Council Members taking their oath of office?”

Items.Title:
The President Pro Tempore will then request:

“Will the Clerk call the Roll for the purpose of ascertaining the presence of a quorum.”  After ascertaining from the Clerk that there is a quorum, the President Pro Tempore will then announce:

“We have a quorum.”
Items.MinutesNote:
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)  then requested:

“Will the Clerk call the Roll for the purpose of ascertaining the presence of a quorum?”

Items.Title:
The President Pro Tempore will state:

“Please rise for today’s Invocation given by Fr. Brian Jordan, Holy Name of Jesus Church, 207 West 96th Street, New York, NY 10025.”

The President Pro Tempore will recognize Council Member Mark-Viverito.

Council Member Mark-Viverito will make the motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record.

The President Pro Tempore states:

“If there be no objections, it is so ordered.”
Items.MinutesNote:
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) stated:

“Please rise for today’s Invocation given by Fr. Brian Jordan, Holy Name of Jesus Church, 207 West 96th Street, New York, NY 10025.”

The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) recognized Council Member Mark-Viverito.
Council Member Mark-Viverito made the motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record.

The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) stated:
“If there be no objections, it is so ordered.”

Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Items.MinutesNote: None

Items.Title: The President Pro Tempore will recognize the Speaker:
Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) recognized the newly re-elected Speaker (Council Member Quinn):

Items.Title: The President Pro Tempore will recognize the Speaker:
Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) recognized the Speaker (Council Member Quinn):

Items.Title:
The President Pro Tempore states:

“Will the Clerk read the designation letter of Minority Leader.”

The Clerk reads:
Items.MinutesNote:
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) asked:

“Will the Clerk read the designation letter of Minority Leader?”

The Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) read:

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
RECESS
Items.MinutesNote: At the request of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Meeting in recess.

Items.Title:
December 22, 2009

Honorable Michael McSweeney
City Clerk and Clerk of the Council
141 Worth Street
New York, New York 10013

Dear City Clerk McSweeney:

Pursuant to Section 42 of the New York City Charter, the first meeting of 2010 of the Council of the city of New York is scheduled for Wednesday, January 6, 2010 at 12:00 noon, in the Council Chambers, second floor, City Hall, New York, New York.

Sincerely,

Christine C. Quinn
Speaker

Items.Title:
December 4, 2009

Honorable Christine C. Quinn
Speaker
New York City Council 
City Hall
New York, New York 10007

Dear Speaker Quinn:

The Commissioners of Elections at their meeting held today certified the November 3, 2009 General Election for Members of the City Council.

	The Following have been elected:

1st 		Margaret S. Chin
2nd 		Rosie Mendez
3rd 		Christine C. Quinn
4th 		Daniel R. Garodnick

Very truly yours,								




Marcus Cederqvist
Executive Director


George Gonzalez
Deputy Executive Director

Items.MatterName: BOARD OF ELECTION-LIST OF ELECTED CITY OFFICIALS

Items.Title:
The President Pro Tempore states:

“I order this communication to be Received, Ordered, Printed and Filed.”
Items.MinutesNote:
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) stated:

“I order this communication to be Received, Ordered, Printed and Filed.”

Items.Title:
By Council Member Rivera:

“I hereby nominate for the Office of the Speaker of the Council of the City of New York, Pursuant to Section 44 of the New York City Charter, for the term commencing January 1, 2010 and terminating December 31, 2013, Council Member Christine C. Quinn.”

After nominations are completed, the clerk will call the Roll.

The President Pro Tempore announces the results and declares:

“The Council Member duly elected as the Speaker of the Council of the City of New York for the term commencing January 1, 2010 and terminating December 31, 2013 is Council Member Christine C. Quinn”
Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)  moved to bring the question to the floor:
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: The President Pro Tempore will recognize Council Member Rivera:

Items.Title:
By the Speaker:

“Motion that pursuant to Section 46 of the New York City Charter, the 2006-2009 Rules of the Council as amended, be continued and in effect until new rules shall be adopted or said rules shall be otherwise amended or modified.”

After the motion is seconded, the President Pro Tempore will state:

“For this roll call, the question on the floor is whether the Council would agree with and adopt such a motion.”

The President Pro Tempore will then state:

“Will the Clerk call the Roll.”

The President Pro Tempore will announce the results of the vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: CONTINUATION OF 2006-2009 RULES OF THE COUNCIL, AS AMENDED

Items.Title:
By the Speaker:

“I nominate the following Council Members as Members of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections of the City Council:

Inez E. Dickens, Chair
Joel Rivera
Leroy G. Comrie Jr.	
Lewis A. Fidler 
Thomas White, Jr.
James S. Oddo
Christine C. Quinn

After the motion is seconded, the President Pro Tempore will state:

“For this roll call, the question on the floor is whether the Council would agree with and adopt such nominations.”

The President Pro Tempore will then state:

“Will the Clerk call the Roll.”

The President Pro Tempore will announce the results of the vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: NOMINATION AND ELECTION OF THE COMMITTEE ON RULES, PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS

Items.Title:
December 30, 2009

Honorable Christine Quinn
Speaker
City Hall
New York, NY 10007

Dear Speaker Quinn:   

We, the undersigned members of the Minority (Republican) Delegation of the Council of the City of New York, hereby designate and appoint James S. Oddo as Minority Leader of the New York City Council, pursuant to Rule 4.10 of the Rules of the Council of the City of New York for the term commencing on January 1, 2010.

Sincerely,


James S. Oddo						           
Minority Leader

				
Dan Halloran
Council Member, 19th District 

     
Vincent Ignizio	
Council Member, 51st District	


Peter Koo
Council Member, 20th District 


Eric Ulrich
Council Member, 32nd District

Items.ActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council

Items.Title: Roll Call

Items.MinutesNote:
After ascertaining from the Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) that there was a quorum, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) then announced:

“We have a quorum.”

* Editor's Note re: revised Attendance and Voting for the Charter Meeting held on January 6, 2010:  The Charter Meeting of January 6, 2010 opened on January 6, 2010 and was adjourned after a brief procedural Recessed Meeting held on January 21, 2010 (shortly before the start of the regularly scheduled Stated Council Meeting of January 21, 2010).  Though not present on January 6, 2010, Council Member Seabrook was present at the Recessed Meeting held on January 21, 2010 and is, therefore, considered present for attendance and voting purposes for the Charter Meeting of January 6, 2010.  Council Member Seabrook chose to cast an affirmative vote on January 21, 2010 for the items presented for a vote at this Charter Meeting held on January 6, 2010 (for revised vote, please see the Charter Meeting votes printed in these Minutes of the Charter Meeting of January 6, 2010).
Christine C. Quinn and Charles Barron were nominated for the Speaker's position for the 2010-2013 Council session.
Christine C. Quinn was re-elected Speaker of the Council  the vote shown above.
The Council Members assembled rose and took their ceremonial Oath of Office administered to them together as a group by the Clerk (Mr. McSweeney).
